snippet: As fireworks exploded over the Hudson River on Thursday night, the Empire State Building took the opportunity to show off a new LED lighting system that can accommodate 16 million colors.
abstract: Empire State Building shows off new LED lighting system, installed in 2012, during 2013 Fourth of July fireworks over Hudson River; lighting system can accommodate 16 million colors, can be programmed remotely to change at the stroke of a key, and glows up to eight times brighter than building's old lights.
lead_paragraph: As fireworks exploded over the Hudson River on Thursday night, the Empire State Building took the opportunity to show off a new LED lighting system that can accommodate 16 million colors.

headline.main: The Empire State Building, Now in 16 Million Colors
headline.print_headline: A Landmark, Now in 16 Million Colors
